text:
I didn’t really make the decision actually. Because I retook yr12 my head of year suggested I do economics because maths clashed with history. I’m glad I took the risk. 

Yeah, I go an A* in maths for GCSE. I enjoyed maths the most out of all the subject I did which is the reason I want to do accounting.

So far I’m thinking about doing an economics degree at Kent next year but I feel like I’ve been limited in my options as to where to go for university because so many require alevels maths. I don’t know much about apprenticeship because I’ve always been pushed to go to uni. 

I’m kind of such on the work experience aspect of completing my personal statement because I don’t know any places to get work experience for someone applying for an economics degree.
